Welcome to GPlayer’s documentation!¶

class gplayer.Cache(fileobj, size, seekable=False, blocksize=2048)¶

Reads out the whole file object to avoid for example stream timeouts. Use Player‘s play_cache() method to play this object.

Attention: This starts a new thread for reading. If you want to cancel this thread you have to call the cancel() method. If you call Player‘s stop() method the cancel() method is automatically called.

Parameters:
  • fileobj – file object to cache
  • size – size to calculate state of caching (and playing)
  • seekable – file object is seekable (not implemented yet)
  • blocksize – size of blocks for reading and caching
cancel()¶

Cancels the reading thread.

read(size=None)¶

Reads in the internal cache. This method should not be used directly. The Player class uses this method to read data for playing.

class gplayer.Player¶

Play media files, file objects and Cache objects over GStreamer. Implemented as gobject.GObject.

GObject Signals:

Signal Meaning
started Source setup is completed and playing will start (not is playing!!!)
finished Playing of the current file, file object or Cache object finished
duration¶

Duration of the current file, file object or Cache object.

Return type:tuple with minutes, seconds, nanoseconds and total nanoseconds
pause()¶

Set state to paused.

play()¶

Set state to playing.

play_cache(cache)¶

Play by Cache object.

Parameters:cache – Cache object to play.
play_file(filename)¶

Play a file by filename.

Parameters:filename – Filename of file to play. Could be absolute or relative.
play_fileobj(fileobj, size=None, seekable=False)¶

Play by file object.

Parameters:
  • fileobj – File object to play.
  • size – Size for duration calculation.
position¶

Current position in the current file, file object or Cache object. You have to set this with nanoseconds to seek in the file. Please do not seek while playing a file object or a Cache object (will be implemented later).

Return type:tuple with minutes, seconds, nanoseconds and total nanoseconds
state¶

States:

Constant Meaning
STATE_PLAYING Player is playing
STATE_PAUSED Player is paused
STATE_READY Player is ready to play a file
stop()¶

Cancel playing. You must call this if state is not STATE_READY and you want to play a new file, file object or Cache object.

volume¶

Volume of the Player. Set this to change volume.

Return type:float where 1 means full volume and 0 means mute.
gplayer.main()¶

Gobject’s main loop. You can also use other gobject main loops for example gtk’s gtk.main().

Not tested because I use gtk.main()... Will test it later.

gplayer.main_quit()¶

Stops the main loop.

Not tested because I use gtk.main()... Will test it later.
